tips: Check blood sugar levels before, during, and after exercise to prevent hypoglycemia.
Keep a record of blood sugar responses to different exercises.
Exercise after meals to help stabilize blood sugar levels.
Avoid exercise during peak insulin or medication action times.
Always have fast-acting carbohydrates (glucose tablets, candy, or juice) readily available in case of low blood sugar.
Drink plenty of water before, during, and after exercise to stay hydrated.
Use comfortable, breathable clothing and proper footwear to prevent injuries.
Eat balanced meals and snacks regularly to maintain stable blood sugar levels throughout the day.
